title: Drawing, "Design for a Crystal Urn with Silver Mounts", ca. 1827–35
medium: Pen and black ink, brush and wash, green water color on paper
signed: Signed in black ink, lower right: J. Seethaler
creditline: Purchased for the Museum by the Advisory Council
description: Ovoidal carved glass urn, with a circular base and tall neck, decorated with spiral fluting. Silver handles terminating in roosters' heads, and attached at their bases to a band of grapevine encircling the body of the object. Signed pen and black ink, lower right: J. Seethaler.

tombstone.epitaph:
Drawing, "Design for a Crystal Urn with Silver Mounts", ca. 1827–35.
ca. 1827–35. Pen and black ink, brush and wash, green water color on paper. Purchased for the Museum by the Advisory Council. 1911-28-330.
